instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2850: What is 820-2850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.820-2530: What is 820-2530? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> TB3T Sensor is faulty in ASD
threads.message:
Hi guys, the machine doesn't recognize the battery and partially working with the charger connected - shut down sometimes. I cannot located the TB3T sensor on the schematics and brd file.
Can someone please direct me to its location? Thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> TB3T Sensor is faulty in ASD
threads.message: It's the battery sensor. Tried a known good battery? Disconnected battery indicator? After that it could be bad ISL or SMC, probably SMC.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> TB3T Sensor is faulty in ASD
threads.message:
Tried with a good known battery, with/with out battery indicator connected shows the same error.
Also, <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> seems to me at fault --- <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>=9.9V with battery and charger connected. <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>=8.8V with only charger connected

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> TB3T Sensor is faulty in ASD
threads.message: 8.8V with just charger would at least indicate an issue with the 6259. Replace it and check the sense resistor circuits.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> TB3T Sensor is faulty in ASD
threads.message: <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> was replaced. Current sense resistors circuits seem to be OK. The voltage remain the same as before - 8.8V and 9.9V. The problem persists

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> TB3T Sensor is faulty in ASD
threads.message: Resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28 of <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>? Voltage on pin 2? Did you use a 6259 not a 6258?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> TB3T Sensor is faulty in ASD
threads.message: I used 6259. Resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28 of <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> is the same - 20.7 ohm. Voltage on pin 2 is 16.5V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> TB3T Sensor is faulty in ASD
threads.message:
My bad, the board number is <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>. Wrote <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> by mistake.
I used 6258. 
The resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28 of <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> is the same - 20.7 ohm. Voltage on pin 2 is 16.5V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> TB3T Sensor is faulty in ASD
threads.message: Bad soldering on 6258 then. PPBUS must be 12.6V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> TB3T Sensor is faulty in ASD
threads.message: I've rechecked the surface for bad soldering and soldered the chip again, same results as before. Any other directions I should look into?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> TB3T Sensor is faulty in ASD
threads.message: The chip is dead, soldering again does not fix that.
